raw.title: [BIP-228] Enable bb-t-MATIC Gauge [Polygon]
raw.author: 0x512fce9B07Ce64590849115EE6B32fd40eC0f5F3
raw.body:
[PR with payload](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/122) 

**Summary:**
The Tetu Protocol has been actively building within the Balancer ecosystem, with tetuBAL serving as its primary Balancer-focused product.
Tetu wants to leverage boosted pool functionality by introducing the [bb-t-matic](https://app.balancer.fi/#/polygon/pool/0xf22a66046b5307842f21b311ecb4c462c24c0635000000000000000000000b15) composable pool which consists of 2 liner pools ([bb-t-WMATIC ](https://app.balancer.fi/#/polygon/pool/0x52cc8389c6b93d740325729cc7c958066cee4262000000000000000000000b0f), [bb-t-stMATIC](https://app.balancer.fi/#/polygon/pool/0x4739e50b59b552d490d3fdc60d200977a38510c0000000000000000000000b10))

The underlying tokens are WMATIC and stMatic. Those tokens will be partially invested in the TETU4626 vaults.

**References/Useful links:**

* Website -[ https://tetu.io/ 2 ](https://tetu.io/)
* Documentation -[ Introduction - Tetu](https://docs.tetu.io/tetu-io/)
* Github Page -[ Tetu · GitHub](https://github.com/tetu-io)
* Communities -[ Tetu](https://discord.gg/wH3GcJ5NPk)

**Protocol Description:**

Tetu is an asset management protocol that implements automated yield farming strategy for users.

**Motivation:**

> The implementation of linear and boosted pools is gradually enhancing Balancer’s capacity to boost capital efficiency throughout the protocol. The robust boosted pool aligns with Balancer’s objective to offer a secure platform for LPs to access external yield sources while simultaneously ensuring efficient liquidity for swapping. This approach benefits both LPs and the DAO, generating yield

**Specifications:**

1. Governance:[ Multi Sig - Tetu ](https://docs.tetu.io/tetu-io/security/multi-sig)
2. Oracles: No
3. Audits:[ docs.tetu.io ](https://docs.tetu.io/tetu-io/security/audits)
4. Centralization vectors: n/a
5. Market History: Tetu token can be volatile in the certain market conditions.

Composable Pool: [0xF22a66046B5307842F21B311ECB4C462c24C0635](https://polygonscan.com/address/0xF22a66046B5307842F21B311ECB4C462c24C0635)

Gauge: [0x508601c0ea0197afB08AA4cbA698c1551f5DA53f](https://etherscan.io/address/0x508601c0ea0197afB08AA4cbA698c1551f5DA53f)

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-495] Enable frxETH/sfrxETH metastable pool gauge [Optimism]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/666

**Summary:**

> We request adding frxETH/sfrxETH metastable pool on optimism to BAL gauge

**References/Useful links:**

> Link to
> • [Website](https://frax.finance/)
> • [Documentation](https://docs.frax.finance/)
> • [Github Page](https://github.com/FraxFinance/frax-solidity)

**Protocol Description:**

> frxETH is Frax's wrapped ETH token and sfrxETH is its staked interest bearing version

**Motivation:**

> As a joint effort with FRAX and Beethoven X, we aim to increase liquidity of FRAX, sFRAX, frxETH, sfrxETH, to make Balancer a liquidity hub for frax assets on optimism. The BAL gauge will facilitate the process.

**Specifications:**

1. **Governance:** FRAX governance process can be seen [here](https://docs.frax.finance/smart-contracts/governance) and their snapshot [here](https://snapshot.org/#/frax.eth).
2. **Oracles:** Rate provider contract for [sfrxETH](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xf752dd899F87a91370C1C8ac1488Aef6be687505), the pool does not rely on additional oracles.
3. **Audits:** See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/other/audits)
4. **Centralization vectors:** see [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/overview).
5. **Market History:** See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/frxeth-and-sfrxeth)
6. **Value:** Balancer will earn the protocol fee on interest bearing sfrxETH in the pool and so will LPs. The BIP-19 flywheel will incentivize TVL to grow here with trading volume and our staked ethereum pillars will continue to have Balancer as their ideal liquidity destination.

Link to pool: https://op.beets.fi/pool/0xa71021492a3966eec735ed1b505afa097c7cfe6f00000000000000000000010d
Link to child gauge: https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xc46AB6Aa92F7c30B8Fb1D445b4B957203EbBbd6e
Root gauge: https://etherscan.io/address/0x5622821A3b993f062Ff691478Bbb7d551c167321#code

**Specification**:

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0x5622821A3b993f062Ff691478Bbb7d551c167321`
gaugeType(string): `Optimism`

Additionally, this pool is requesting `core pool` status as per BIP-457

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-494] Enable FRAX/sfrxETH gauge [Optimism]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/665

**Summary:**
> We request adding FRAX/sfrxETH 50/50 weighted pool on optimism to BAL gauge 

**References/Useful links:**
> Link to
    • [Website](https://frax.finance/)
    • [Documentation](https://docs.frax.finance/)
    • [Github Page](https://github.com/FraxFinance/frax-solidity)

**Protocol Description:**

> Frax is a stable coin issued by Frax and sfrxETH is a Frax’s staked wrapped ETH token

**Motivation:**

> As a joint effort with FRAX and Beethoven X, we aim to increase liquidity of FRAX, sFRAX, frxETH, sfrxETH, to make Balancer a liquidity hub for frax assets on optimism. The BAL gauge will facilitate the process. 

**Specifications:**
 
1. **Governance:** FRAX governance process can be seen [here](https://docs.frax.finance/smart-contracts/governance) and their snapshot [here](https://snapshot.org/#/frax.eth).
2. **Oracles:** Rate provider contract for [sfrxETH](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xf752dd899F87a91370C1C8ac1488Aef6be687505), the pool does not rely on additional oracles. 
3. **Audits:** See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/other/audits)
4. **Centralization vectors:** see [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/overview). 
5. **Market History:** See [FRAX](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/frax) and [sfrxETH](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/frxeth-and-sfrxeth)
6. **Value:** Balancer will earn the protocol fee on interest bearing sfrxETH in the pool and so will LPs. The BIP-19 flywheel will incentivize TVL to grow here with trading volume and our staked ethereum pillars will continue to have Balancer as their ideal liquidity destination.

Link to pool: https://op.beets.fi/pool/0x478980c67d53cd990f2b7bab311ddc9934324e7b00020000000000000000010c
Link to child gauge: https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x317e0451Da949Ee999aAc2d7Bc063737f5Fe84e5
Link to root gauge: https://etherscan.io/address/0x057e7b14DC461f071958e0BbF42b5597564D4e6C#code

**Specification**:

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0x057e7b14DC461f071958e0BbF42b5597564D4e6C`
gaugeType(string): `Optimism`

Additionally, this pool is requesting `core pool` status as per BIP-457

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-729] Enable WBTC/pumpBTC Gauge [Ethereum]
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1480

### SUMMARY

This is a proposal to enable a veBAL gauge for the WBTC/pumpBTC pool on Ethereum.

### References/Useful links

Link to:

• [Website](https://mainnet.pumpbtc.xyz/)

• [Documentation](https://pumpbtc.gitbook.io/pumpbtc)

• [Github Page](https://github.com/pumpbtc/pumpBTC-contract)

• [X](https://x.com/Pumpbtcxyz)

### Protocol Description

PumpBTC serves as a Liquid Staking Solution for Babylon. Its mission is to bring DeFi into the Bitcoin ecosystem, driven by an ecosystem-centric approach and supported by seasoned DeFi experts and industry-leading partners.

By abstracting complexities, PumpBTC facilitates effortless collaboration between users and Babylon. Users can stake into Babylon with a single action through PumpBTC, immediately receiving liquidity tokens without waiting periods.

Inspired by the "pump" meme culture in the Bitcoin community, PumpBTC aims to help BTC holders maximize yields through Babylon's liquid staking - essentially rebuilding WBTC/BTCB with native yield.

The historical price of pumpBTC can be found here:

https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/pumpbtc

https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/pumpbtc/

### Motivation

PumpBTC is launching further strategic pools.

### Specifications

#### Governance

#### The governance token has not been released yet.

#### Oracles

RedStone:[ 0x85C4F855Bc0609D2584405819EdAEa3aDAbfE97D](https://app.redstone.finance/app/feeds/?search=pumpBTC&page=1&sortBy=popularity&sortDesc=false&perPage=32)

##### Audits

* [BlockSec Security Audit Report for PumpBTC](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kUmOPM8J63JmzM20H1Cg38oAfPRBJwLy/view?pli=1)
* [Quantstamp Security Audit Report for PumpBTC](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xWQlC4iZenwHrjNOsBdKyVkFbEaUnwD-/view)

#### Centralization vectors

No centralization vectors.

#### Value

The balancer pool is one of the few LRT pools on Ethereum and is aimed at providing liquidity to the growing community. Additionally, pumpBTC will always be pegged 1:1 with WBTC, and users can instantly withdraw at any time.

##### Market History

Market history and protocol information can be found here on the PumpBTC Dune dashboard - https://dune.com/pumpbtcintern/pumpbtc-summary

##### Value

The WBTC-pumpBTC pool on Balancer is intended to serve as one of the primary liquidity sources for the token on Ethereum. The pairing of WBTC with pumpBTC will maintain the originally intended smooth trading experience, while yielding more rewards for the liquidity providers.

##### Contracts

pumpBTC on Ethereum: `0xf469fbd2abcd6b9de8e169d128226c0fc90a012e`

WBTC/pumpBTC Base pool on Balancer: https://balancer.fi/pools/ethereum/v2/0x2238ab6c8c58473a5e81b86ec352322fb3f5edd80000000000000000000006de

##### Specification

* Mainnet Gauge: https://etherscan.io/address/0xDFaD195F91e1591ae8Eb4c1c7183185CeF58864D

Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860`
will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:

gauge(address): `0xDFaD195F91e1591ae8Eb4c1c7183185CeF58864D`

gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-219] Enable bb-t-USD Gauge [Polygon]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
**Transaction Payload**
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/117

**Summary:**
The Tetu Protocol has been actively building within the Balancer ecosystem, with tetuBAL serving as its primary Balancer-focused product. 
Tetu wants to leverage boosted pool functionality by introducing the [bb-t-usd](https://app.balancer.fi/#/polygon/pool/0xb3d658d5b95bf04e2932370dd1ff976fe18dd66a000000000000000000000ace) composable pool which consists of 3 liner pools ([bb-t-USDC](https://app.balancer.fi/#/polygon/pool/0xae646817e458c0be890b81e8d880206710e3c44e000000000000000000000acb), [bb-t-DAI](https://app.balancer.fi/#/polygon/pool/0xda1cd1711743e57dd57102e9e61b75f3587703da000000000000000000000acc), [bb-t-USDT](https://app.balancer.fi/#/polygon/pool/0x7c82a23b4c48d796dee36a9ca215b641c6a8709d000000000000000000000acd))

The underlying tokens are USDC, DAI, and USDT. Those tokens will be partially invested in the TETU4626 vaults ([USDC](https://app.tetu.io/vault/0xee3b4ce32a6229ae15903cda0a5da92e739685f7), [DAI](https://app.tetu.io/vault/0xb4607d4b8ecfafd063b3a3563c02801c4c7366b2), [USDT](https://app.tetu.io/vault/0xe680e0317402ad3cb37d5ed9fc642702658ef57f)) to earn yield from dFORCE / MESH / AAVE optimized according to the market conditions. 

**References/Useful links:**

* Website -[ https://tetu.io/ 2 ](https://tetu.io/)
* Documentation -[ Introduction - Tetu](https://docs.tetu.io/tetu-io/)
* Github Page -[ Tetu · GitHub](https://github.com/tetu-io)
* Communities -[ Tetu](https://discord.gg/wH3GcJ5NPk)

**Protocol Description:**

Tetu is an asset management protocol that implements automated yield farming strategy for users.

**Motivation:**

> The implementation of linear and boosted pools is gradually enhancing Balancer's capacity to boost capital efficiency throughout the protocol. The robust boosted pool aligns with Balancer's objective to offer a secure platform for LPs to access external yield sources while simultaneously ensuring efficient liquidity for swapping. This approach benefits both LPs and the DAO, generating yield

**Specifications:**
 
1. Governance:[ Multi Sig - Tetu ](https://docs.tetu.io/tetu-io/security/multi-sig)
2. Oracles: No
3. Audits:[ docs.tetu.io](https://docs.tetu.io/tetu-io/security/audits)
4. Centralization vectors: n/a
5. Market History: Tetu token can be volatile in the certain market conditions.

Composable Pool: [0xb3d658d5b95BF04E2932370DD1FF976fe18dd66A](https://polygonscan.com/address/0xb3d658d5b95BF04E2932370DD1FF976fe18dd66A)
Gauge: [0x28D4FE67c68d340fe66CfbCBe8e2cd279d8AA6dD](https://etherscan.io/address/0x28D4FE67c68d340fe66CfbCBe8e2cd279d8AA6dD)

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal to enable the xRPL/RPL gauge on Ethereum for Balancer aims to incentivize liquidity provision and support the Rocket Pool governance token trading. Voting and timeline analysis strongly support the 'Yes' option. Forum sentiment is positive overall, highlighting benefits such as deeper liquidity and strengthened yield ecosystems. Historical similar proposals also favored enabling gauges with mostly positive outcomes, supporting the strategic benefit of this change.
key_arguments_for: Enables BAL emissions for the xRPL/RPL pool, incentivizing liquidity provision.
Supports deeper liquidity and efficient governance token trading for Rocket Pool users.
Aligns with Balancer's strategic interest in governance tokens and staking infrastructure.
Similar past proposals to enable gauges have passed successfully and supported the protocol.
key_arguments_against: Potential short-term market and TVL declines observed in similar proposals suggest risk to immediate metrics.
No explicit forum comments opposing the proposal were found, but low overall vote participation could indicate some community uncertainty.

evidence.quote: Proposal seeks to enable the gauge for xRPL/RPL pool on Balancer to incentivize liquidity and support RPL trading. Forum sentiment is positive with no negative comments before proposal end.
All votes cast supported 'Yes, let's do it' with stable and early voter engagement indicating strong early consensus.
Similar past proposals enabling gauges or updating signer sets had mostly positive vote outcomes but exhibited minor short-term price and TVL declines.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Voting timeline shows unanimous and stable support for enabling the gauge, indicating early and consistent consensus.
- Forum sentiment is predominantly positive, with detailed rationale supporting liquidity incentives and governance token ecosystem benefits.
- Historical similar proposals to enable gauges were also supported and brought long-term benefits despite some short-term market impacts.
- Market and TVL impact data suggest caution, but do not outweigh the strategic benefits; the recommendation aligns with community sentiment and protocol interests.
